title: Unpopular Opinion: Make it legal to leave after 5 deaths straight
body:
I see no point to continue to play after getting unlucky in the lane. The snowball mechanic in the game makes it that if you lose your luck by misstep into a hook or JG camping you lose the lane entirely and no windows of opportunity of redemption. 

People go against this saying that the entire team needs to function in order to win. However, if you are an important piece of the team (support, AOE bruiser, battlemage, etc) then you're probably bringing the whole team down. Unless if they give a boost toward players who have a low KD (which doesn't seem likely given the removal of catch up XP), it seems absolutely justified to make this change. Other players may say just to practice, which may not be applied simply because "We are having a bad day."

Oh really? Then how it is that EVERY other game has a troll, an int or an afk in it?
Dying five times in a row isn't bad luck. It's you overestimating your strength and/or underestimating your opponents, then refusing to play safe after your opponent gets ahead.

Lol, i guarantee the result of this would make you madder than you probably imagine is possible.

It may be a hard concept to grasp but _other_ people could do this and would just int 5 deaths and quit every time your wonderful personality annoyed them.
So... what you are saying is that you should essentially be rewarded for inting? Yeah no.
Why would this ever be a thing, it practically encourages inting just to get out of a game.

idk how many times ive gone 0-3 due to being vs tower diver Jungler+tower diver laner.
Sometimes dying is unavoidable.
Get over it, you can still be relevant.

You deserve to be banned if u go afk after 0-3.

I don't think this would be a good Idea.

It will more or less encourage those to Intentionally Feed to get out of games, which can definitely be abused by those looking to grief people trying to play the game.
Now to those not looking to troll & simply want out of an unfavorable game, then they would be the only one who really benefits from it since they can just leave. Meanwhile that person leaves 4 other teammates get to suffer through an uneven/unwinnable game.

In the end, the con's outweigh the pro's in** dramatic fashion**. The only real thing you can do is play out the match & try to help out your team while playing from behind. Afterwards, take notes & learn something from after the game. Keep those notes in mind the next time have to play that lane matchup.
